sen.e: KASA no Iratsume (Lady Kasa) was a poet of the mid-Nara period.

sen.j: 大伴家持とかかわりのあった十余人の女性のひとりで、同時代では大伴坂上郎女とならび称されるすぐれた女性歌人。
sen.e: She was one of among more than ten lovers of OTOMO no Yakamochi, and was an poetess as excellent as her contemporary, OTOMO no Sakanoue no Iratsume.

sen.e: Twenty-nine of her poems appear in volumes three, four and eight of the "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves).

sen.j: 内訳は、譬喩歌3首、相聞歌24首、春および秋の相聞各1首。
sen.e: In detail, three of them were metaphorical poems, twenty-four were love poems, and there was one love poem each for spring and autumn.

sen.j: 森鴎外らが訳詩集『於母影』（1889年）を出すにあたって、396番歌を題名の典拠としたことはよく知られる。
sen.e: It is widely known that when Ogai MORI and others published the "Omokage" (1889), an anthology of poems in translation, they used the 396th poem of the Manyoshu as the source for its title.
